questions.text: Which of the following hormones have an intracellular receptor?
questions.solution:
• Thyroxine hormones have intracellular receptors.
  • Steroid and thyroid hormones bind to the intracellular receptors which regulate gene transcription.
  • The hormone diffuses through the cell membrane into the cytoplasm and combines with the receptor which is present either in cytoplasm or in nucleus.
  • The receptor for glucocorticoid is present in cytoplasm whereas the receptor for thyroxine and other steroid hormones are located in the nucleus.

Other options:

Option B,C and D: Glucagon, Epinephrine and Parathormone bind to receptors present on the cell membrane. The peptide hormones bind to the cell surface receptors and activate a series of intracellular signal transduction systems.

choices.text: No such infinite feedback gain is not possible

questions.text: In negative feedback, feedback gain is infinity in which of the following
questions.solution:
• In negative feedback, feedback gain is infinity in blood volume control by kidney. The renal-body fluid system for arterial pressure control is a fundamental mechanism for long-term arterial pressure control.
  • The degree of effectiveness with which a control system maintains constant conditions is determined by the gain of negative feedback.
  • Gain= Correction/Error
  • The renal-body fluid mechanism causes the blood volume to return to the normal value that is to the equilibrium point due to negative feedback mechanism resulting in zero error so gain of the renal-body fluid system will be infinity.

Other options:

Option A: The gain of the system controlling internal body temperature when a person is exposed to moderately cold weather is about −33.

Option C: In the baroreceptor system example, if the correction is −50 mm Hg and the error persisting is +25 mm Hg.

So the gain of the person's baroreceptor system for control of arterial pressure is

−50 /+25 = −2.

Option D: Infinite feedback gain is possible as seen in the case of renal body-fluid mechanism.

questions.text: In skeletal muscle DHPR & RYR receptors are coupled by?
questions.solution:
• In skeletal muscle DHPR & RYR receptors are coupled mechanically.
  • The membrane of T-tubules contains voltage-gated Ca2+ channels called dihydropyridine (DHP) receptors.
  • When the action potential reaches the tip of Ttubule, it activates the DHP receptors.
  • Activated DHP receptors in turn trigger the opening of Ca2+ release channels located on the terminal cisterns known as ryanodine receptors (RYR).
  • This is possible as the lateral cisterns are located very close to the tips of T-tubules and the protein channels of the cisterns i.e DHP and RYR are mechanically interlocked.

questions.text: Calculate ECF volume from the following. 10gm mannitol injection given in venous blood. At equilibrium, urinary excretion 10% & plasma concentration of mannitol is 65mg/100ml.

A 65-year-old male patient visited the ER for chest pain and his BP was measured as SBP 190 mmHg, DBP 100 mmHg, Pulse pressure 90 mmHg. Which of the following parameter that should decrease for this high pulse pressure
questions.solution:
• Arterial wall compliance should decrease for the high pulse pressure.
  • The pulse pressure is the difference between the systolic and diastolic blood pressure.
  • With increment in age, there is increase in systolic blood pressure but there is decrease in diastolic blood pressure due to increased arterial stiffness which occurs due to decrease in arterial wall compliance which results in increase in pulse pressure.

choices.text: Volume of serum in the kidney in 24hrs

questions.text: Which of the following is not required for calculation of creatinine clearance?
questions.solution:
Volume of serum in the kidney in 24 hours is not required for calculation of creatinine clearance.

Creatinine is a by-product of muscle metabolism and is cleared from the body fluids almost entirely by glomerular filtration.

Therefore, creatinine clearance can be used to assess GFR (Glomerular Filtration Rate).

Creatinine clearance is not a perfect marker of GFR because a small amount of it is secreted by the tubule.

Creatinine clearance provides a reasonable estimate of GFR.

questions.text: Single neuron receive 500 inputs from 150 different sensory cells
questions.solution:
Single neuron receives 500 inputs from 150 different sensory cells and refers to convergence.

Convergence means signals from multiple inputs uniting to excite a single neuron.

Convergence can result from multiple input fibers from a single source.

Convergence can also result from input signals (excitatory or inhibitory) from multiple sources.

Convergence is one of the important means whereby the central nervous system correlates, summates, and sorts different types of information.

questions.text: Mechanism of Transcutaneous Electrical Stimulation (TENS) for pain management
questions.solution:
• Gate control theory is the mechanism behind Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS).
  • This method uses electrodes to activate Aα and Aβ fibers in the vicinity of the injury. The relief is due to activation of innocuous cutaneous mechanoreceptors whose afferents emit collaterals that terminate in the dorsal horn.
  • The activity of these cutaneous mechanosensitive afferents reduce the responsiveness of dorsal horn neurons to their input from nociceptive afferent terminals. This is called the gate-control mechanism of pain modulation.

questions.text: In physiology viva, the examiner asked the student "who recorded the first human EEG? Student responded, 'I don't know'. Examiner felt bad and decided to give him a hint, "the name rhymes with what you get at McDonald's" Then the student gave the right answer. Here, the student uses which type of memory
questions.solution:
In the above scenario student uses semantic memory in which priming is used

Priming is the facilitation of the recognition of words or objects by prior exposure to them and is dependent on the neocortex.

Option B: Nonassociative learning includes habituation and sensitization which is independent on various reflex pathways.

Option c: Associative learning relates to classical and operant conditioning in which one learns about the relationship between one stimulus and another. This type of memory is dependant on the amygdala for its emotional responses and the cerebellum for the motor responses.

Option D: Declarative or explicit memory is for factual knowledge about people, places, and things. It is divided into semantic memory for facts (eg: words, rules, and language) and episodic memory for events.

questions.text: The graph below shows the normal rate of synthesis of the various haemoglobin chains in utero, and after birth. Gamma chain of haemoglobin is indicated by which of the following
questions.solution:
Gamma chain of haemoglobin is indicated by Curve B.

The blood of the human fetus normally contains fetal hemoglobin (hemoglobin F). Its structure is similar to that of Hemoglobin A except that the β chains are replaced by γ chains. The γ chains have 37 amino acid residues that differ from those in the β chain. Fetal hemoglobin is normally replaced by adult hemoglobin soon after birth.

Other options:

Option A: Curve A- Alpha chain

Option C: Curve C- Epsilon chain

Option D: Curve D- Beta chain

questions.text: Intercellular communication in eukaryotes is by
questions.solution:
Intercellular communication in eukaryotes is by exosome. Exosomes are derived from Multivesicular bodies (MVB). These extracellular vesicles are mediators of cell to cell communication in eukaryotes.

Other options:

Option A: Lysosomes are membrane-bound spherical organelles which contain a variety of hydrolytic enzymes meant for intracytoplasmic digestion. Lysosomes remove intracellular products of metabolism from the cell.

Option B: Peroxisomes are small spherical organelles that contain oxidases which promote oxidation of lipids and catalases that liberate oxygen from H2O2. They protect the tissue from oxidative stress.

Option C: The genetic information stored in chromosomes of a cell is known as the genome. The human genome contains about 3 billion nucleotide pairs and in diploid cells they are organized into 23 pairs of chromosome
